xxl.core.io.converters
Class BigDecimalConverter

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.io.converters.Converter<java.math.BigDecimal>
      xxl.core.io.converters.BigDecimalConverter
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class BigDecimalConverter
extends Converter<java.math.BigDecimal>

This class provides a converter that is able to read and write BigDecimal objects.

Example usage (1). 

   // create a byte array output stream
   
   ByteArrayOutputStream output = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
   
   // write two values to the output stream
   
   BigDecimalConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.write(new DataOutputStream(output), new BigDecimal("2.7236512"));
   BigDecimalConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.write(new DataOutputStream(output), new BigDecimal("6.123853"));
   
   // create a byte array input stream on the output stream
   
   ByteArrayInputStream input = new ByteArrayInputStream(output.toByteArray());
   
   // read the values from the input stream
   
   BigDecimal d1 = BigDecimalConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.read(new DataInputStream(input));
   BigDecimal d2 = BigDecimalConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.read(new DataInputStream(input));
   
   // print the objects
   
   System.out.println(d1);
   System.out.println(d2);
   
   // close the streams after use
   
   input.close();
   output.close();

See Also:
DataInput, DataOutput, IOException, Serialized Form

Field Detail

DEFAULT_INSTANCE

public static final BigDecimalConverter DEFAULT_INSTANCE
This instance can be used for getting a default instance of a big decimal converter. It is similar to the Singleton Design Pattern (for further details see Creational Patterns, Prototype in Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software by Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, and John Vlissides) except that there are no mechanisms to avoid the creation of other instances of a big decimal converter.

BigDecimalConverter

public BigDecimalConverter()
Method Detail

read

public java.math.BigDecimal read(java.io.DataInput dataInput,
                                 java.math.BigDecimal object)
                          throws java.io.IOException
Reads the BigDecimal value for the specified (BigDecimal) object from the specified data input and returns the restored object.

This implementation ignores the specified object and returns a new BigDecimal object. So it does not matter when the specified object is null.

Specified by:
read in class Converter<java.math.BigDecimal>
Parameters:
dataInput - the stream to read the BigDecimal value from in order to return a BigDecimal object.
object - the (BigDecimal) object to be restored. In this implementation it is ignored.
Returns:
the read BigDecimal object.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if I/O errors occur.

write

public void write(java.io.DataOutput dataOutput,
                  java.math.BigDecimal object)
           throws java.io.IOException
Writes the BigDecimal value of the specified BigDecimal object to the specified data output.

Specified by:
write in class Converter<java.math.BigDecimal>
Parameters:
dataOutput - the stream to write the BigDecimal value of the specified BigDecimal object to.
object - the BigDecimal object that BigDecimal value should be written to the data output.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.
